com.igeekinc.util.datadescriptor

Interface DataDescriptor

  • All Superinterfaces:
    DataSource, java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BasicDataDescriptor, CompositeDataDescriptor, FileDataDescriptor

    public interface DataDescriptor
extends java.io.Serializable, DataSource

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Tells the descriptor that we're not planning to use it anymore and that it can release file handles, etc.
      boolean descriptorContainsData()
      Returns true if the data is contained within the descriptor (e.g.
      java.nio.ByteBuffer getByteBuffer()
      Returns all of the data referenced by the descriptor
      byte[] getData()
      Returns all of the data referenced by the descriptor
      int getData(byte[] destination, int destOffset, long srcOffset, int length, boolean release)
      Reads some of the data from the descriptor
      int getData(java.nio.ByteBuffer destination, long srcOffset, int length, boolean release)
      Reads some of the data from the descriptor
      java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Integer> getDataAsync(java.nio.ByteBuffer destination, long srcOffset, int length, boolean release) 
      <A> void getDataAsync(java.nio.ByteBuffer destination, long srcOffset, int length, boolean release, A attachment, AsyncCompletion<java.lang.Integer,? super A> handler) 
      java.io.InputStream getInputStream()
      Returns an InputStream that will read all of the data referenced by the descriptor
      long getLength()
      Length of the data
      boolean isAccessible()
      Returns true if the data is currently accessible.
      boolean isShareableWithLocalProcess()
      Returns true if this descriptor can be given to another process on the same machine and still work (for example, a FileDataDescriptor which holds a path)
      boolean isShareableWithRemoteProcess()
      Returns true if this descriptor can be given to a process on a different host and still work (for example, a NetworkDataDescriptor)
      void writeData(java.io.FileOutputStream destinationStream)
      Writes the data referenced by the descriptor into the destinationStream (specifying FileOutputStream allows us to use FileChannel internally)
      void writeData(java.io.OutputStream destinationStream)
      Writes the data referenced by the descriptor into the destinationStream

      • getData

        int getData(byte[] destination,
          int destOffset,
          long srcOffset,
          int length,
          boolean release)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Reads some of the data from the descriptor
        Parameters:
        destination - - buffer to read data into
        destOffset - - offset in the destination buffer
        srcOffset - - offset in the source data
        length - - bytes to read
        release - - release the data descriptor after this read (cannot be used again after this is called)
        Returns:
        number of bytes read
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getData

        int getData(java.nio.ByteBuffer destination,
          long srcOffset,
          int length,
          boolean release)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Reads some of the data from the descriptor
        Parameters:
        destination - - buffer to read data into - data is written at the current buffer offset
        srcOffset - - offset in the source data
        length - - bytes to read
        release - - release the data descriptor after this read (cannot be used again after this is called)
        Returns:
        number of bytes read
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • isShareableWithLocalProcess

        boolean isShareableWithLocalProcess()
        Returns true if this descriptor can be given to another process on the same machine and still work (for example, a FileDataDescriptor which holds a path)
        Returns:

      • isShareableWithRemoteProcess

        boolean isShareableWithRemoteProcess()
        Returns true if this descriptor can be given to a process on a different host and still work (for example, a NetworkDataDescriptor)
        Returns:

      • isAccessible

        boolean isAccessible()
        Returns true if the data is currently accessible. Returns false if it is not. (For example, a data descriptor that is only locally accessible that is sent to a remote machine)
        Returns:

      • descriptorContainsData

        boolean descriptorContainsData()
        Returns true if the data is contained within the descriptor (e.g. BasicDataDescriptor which contains the memory buffer)
        Returns:

      • close

        void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Tells the descriptor that we're not planning to use it anymore and that it can release file handles, etc.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
